headline.main: Ask About Health in New York

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: James R. Knickman, the president and chief executive of the New York State Health Foundation, is answering reader readers this week about health coverage, public health problems and a range of related issues.
docs.lead_paragraph: James R. Knickman, the president and chief executive Officer of the New York State Health Foundation, is taking questions from City Room readers through March 29 on a range of issues from universal health care and Medicaid to the prevalence in New York of problems like obesity, diabetes, smoking and substance abuse.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: James R. Knickman, the president and chief executive of the New York State Health Foundation, is answering reader readers this week about health coverage, public health problems and a range of related issues.

docs.abstract: Will Okun is a Chicago school teacher who traveled with Nick Kristof in June to central Africa, on the win-a-trip contest. He teaches English and photography in a Chicago school with many students from low-income and minority homes. In a recent blog post, he wrote: "Not much excites my sleepy 1st period high school class before the 9 a.m. hour. However, a newspaper article about the most recent Centers for Disease Control and Prevention study elicited a collective "damn." According to the study, nearly half of all black teenage girls in America have at least one sexually transmitted disease."
docs.lead_paragraph: Will Okun is a Chicago school teacher who traveled with Nick Kristof in June to central Africa, on the win-a-trip contest. He blogged and vlogged as he went, and you can see his reports at www.nytimes.com/twofortheroad. He teaches English and photography in a Chicago school with many students from low-income and minority homes.

headline.print_headline: Research Center to Study Health-Race Link
headline.main: Research Center to Study Health-Race Link

docs.lead_paragraph: The Center for Genomics and Health Disparities will aim to untangle the genetic, economic and social factors that contribute to differences in disease rates among races.
docs.snippet: The Center for Genomics and Health Disparities will aim to untangle the genetic, economic and social factors that contribute to differences in disease rates among races.

headline.print_headline: To a Middle School’s Three R’s, Add an S: Skateboarding
headline.main: To a Middle School’s Three R’s, Add an S: Skateboarding

docs.lead_paragraph: A skateboarding class at the Merrick Avenue Middle School on Long Island is part of a new wave of individual sports instruction designed to make physical education fun.
docs.snippet: A skateboarding class at the Merrick Avenue Middle School on Long Island is part of a new wave of individual sports instruction designed to make physical education fun.
